author: Francisco-Gamino
body:
<!--

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->
## Steps to reproduce

Build PowerShell on Linux
Start a new instance of the built PowerShell
Cd into a long path, e.g., /home/localadmin/PowerShell/src/powershell-unix/bin/Linux/netcoreapp1.0/ubuntu.16.04-x64/Modules/Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive
## Expected behavior

PowerShell still works
## Actual behavior

PowerShell becomes unusable

PS /home/localadmin/PowerShell/src/powershell-unix/bin/Linux/netcoreapp1.0/ubuntu.16.04-x64/Modules/Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive> 
Oops, something went wrong.  Please report this bug with the details below.
## Report on GitHub: https://github.com/lzybkr/PSReadLine/issues/new

Last 200 Keys:
 c d Spacebar / h o m e / l o c a l a d m i n / P o w e r S h e l l / s r c / p o w e r s h e l l - u n i x / b i n / L i n u x / n e t c o r e a p p 1 . 0 / u b u n t u . 1 6 . 0 4 - x 6 4 / p o w e r s h e l l Backspace Backspace Backspace Backspace Backspace Backspace Backspace Backspace Backspace Backspace Backspace Enter
 d i r Enter
 c d Spacebar e n Tab Enter
 d i r Enter
 c d Spacebar m o Tab d u Tab Backspace Backspace Backspace Backspace M o d u l Tab Enter
 UpArrow Tab Backspace Backspace Backspace Backspace Backspace Backspace Backspace Backspace Backspace Backspace c d d Spacebar . . Enter
 d i r Enter
 c d Spacebar . . Enter
 c d Spacebar M o Tab Enter
 d i r Enter
 c d Spacebar i Backspace M i Tab A Tab Enter

Exception:
System.IndexOutOfRangeException: Index was outside the bounds of the array.
   at Microsoft.PowerShell.PSConsoleReadLine.Initialize(Runspace runspace, EngineIntrinsics engineIntrinsics) in /home/localadmin/PowerShell/src/Microsoft.PowerShell.PSReadLine/ReadLine.cs:line 565
##    at Microsoft.PowerShell.PSConsoleReadLine.ReadLine(Runspace runspace, EngineIntrinsics engineIntrinsics) in /home/localadmin/PowerShell/src/Microsoft.PowerShell.PSReadLine/ReadLine.cs:line 276
## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

``` powershell
> $PSVersionTable


Name                           Value                                                                                  
----                           -----                                                                                  
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha                                                                            
PSEdition                      Core                                                                                   
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                                                                
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0                                                                                
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.7-350-g383a0d7493909dc4828f4ffad587d0f8be7ec10f                           
CLRVersion                                                                                                            
WSManStackVersion              3.0                                                                                    
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                                                                    
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1                                                                                


```
title: Accessing long paths on Linux causes PowerShell to be unusable
